Token.Abstract: @class FBAppCall
@abstract The ID of this FBAppCall instance
@abstract The ID of this FBAppCall instance
@abstract Error that occurred in processing this AppCall
@abstract Error that occurred in processing this AppCall
@abstract Data related to a Dialog AppCall
@abstract Data related to a Dialog AppCall
@abstract Data for native app link
@abstract Data for native app link
@abstract Access Token that was returned in this AppCall
@abstract Access Token that was returned in this AppCall
@abstract Returns an FBAppCall instance from a url, if applicable. Otherwise, returns nil.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The url.

ReturnValue.Abstract:
an FBAppCall instance if the url is valid; nil otherwise.
@discussion This is typically used for App Link URLs.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Compares the receiving FBAppCall to the passed in FBAppCall

Parameter.Name: appCall
Parameter.Abstract: the other FBAppCall to compare to.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the AppCalls can be considered to be the same; NO if otherwise.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method from the [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:] method of the AppDelegate for your app. It should be invoked for the proper processing of responses during interaction with the native Facebook app or as part of SSO authorization flow.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The URL as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: sourceApplication
Parameter.Abstract: The sourceApplication as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the url was intended for the Facebook SDK, NO if not.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method from the [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:] method of the AppDelegate for your app. It should be invoked for the proper processing of responses during interaction with the native Facebook app or as part of SSO authorization flow.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The URL as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: sourceApplication
Parameter.Abstract: The sourceApplication as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: handler
Parameter.Abstract: Optional handler that gives the app the opportunity to do some further processing on urls that the SDK could not completely process. A fallback handler is not a requirement for such a url to be considered handled. The fallback handler, if specified, is only ever called sychronously, before the method returns.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the url was intended for the Facebook SDK, NO if not.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method from the [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:] method of the AppDelegate for your app. It should be invoked for the proper processing of responses during interaction with the native Facebook app or as part of SSO authorization flow.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The URL as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: sourceApplication
Parameter.Abstract: The sourceApplication as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: session
Parameter.Abstract: If this url is being sent back to this app as part of SSO authorization flow, then pass in the session that was being opened. A nil value defaults to FBSession.activeSession

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the url was intended for the Facebook SDK, NO if not.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method from the [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:] method of the AppDelegate for your app. It should be invoked for the proper processing of responses during interaction with the native Facebook app or as part of SSO authorization flow.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The URL as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: sourceApplication
Parameter.Abstract: The sourceApplication as passed to [UIApplicationDelegate application:openURL:sourceApplication:annotation:].

Parameter.Name: session
Parameter.Abstract: If this url is being sent back to this app as part of SSO authorization flow, then pass in the session that was being opened. A nil value defaults to FBSession.activeSession

Parameter.Name: handler
Parameter.Abstract: Optional handler that gives the app the opportunity to do some further processing on urls that the SDK could not completely process. A fallback handler is not a requirement for such a url to be considered handled. The fallback handler, if specified, is only ever called sychronously, before the method returns.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the url was intended for the Facebook SDK, NO if not.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method when the application's applicationDidBecomeActive: is invoked. This ensures proper state management of any pending FBAppCalls or pending login flow for the FBSession.activeSession. If any pending FBAppCalls are found, their registered callbacks will be invoked with appropriate state

@abstract Call this method when the application's applicationDidBecomeActive: is invoked. This ensures proper state management of any pending FBAppCalls or a pending open for the passed in FBSession. If any pending FBAppCalls are found, their registered callbacks will be invoked with appropriate state

Parameter.Name: session
Parameter.Abstract: Session that is currently being used. Any pending calls to open will be cancelled. If no session is provided, then the activeSession (if present) is used.

Token.Abstract: @abstract Call this method from the main thread to fetch deferred applink data. This may require a network round trip. If successful, [+UIApplication openURL:] is invoked with the link data. Otherwise, the fallbackHandler will be dispatched to the main thread.

Parameter.Name: fallbackHandler

Token.Abstract: @abstract Designated initializer for FBAppCall

Parameter.Name: ID
Parameter.Abstract: the unique identifier for matching the FBAppCall. If nil, a random uid will be generated

Parameter.Name: enforceScheme
Parameter.Abstract: a flag determining if we need to detect if the url scheme that will be used for a FAS is correctly configured to allow a callback from iOS. In general, if you are creating an "outbound" FBAppCall, you should use the default of YES to make sure the schemes are set correctly. If the scheme is not set correctly, a developer error is logged and this will return nil.

Parameter.Name: appID
Parameter.Abstract: the explicit app id to use. If nil, defaults to [FBSettings defaultAppID]

Parameter.Name: urlSchemeSuffix
